subject: Data
title: Quipu: The Inca Data System
description: Learn Quipu: The Inca Data System in one minute.

hook.text: The Inca Empire ruled 12 million people without a written language. How did they manage?

buildup.text: They used quipu â€” bundles of knotted strings where each knot position encoded a number.

discovery.text: Different string colors represented categories: gold for treasure, red for soldiers, white for silver.

twist.text: Researchers now believe some quipu encoded narratives, not just numbers â€” a lost data language.

climax.text: Only about 600 quipu survive today, and most remain undeciphered.

punchline.text: The Incas built a database from string and knots.

quiz.question: What were Inca quipu primarily used for?
options: Recording numerical and possibly narrative data
